item.title: 早间竞标中国 "火箭筒 "烟消云散，美元继续前行
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: First Solar 称多家大型竞争对手侵犯其专利权
item.description: 美国太阳能电池板制造商 First Solar 公司高管周二在与分析师的电话会议上表示，该公司已通知几家大型竞争对手，认为他们侵犯了其一项领先太阳能技术的专利权。【原文：U.S. solar panel maker First Solar has notified several large rivals that it believes they are infringing on its patents on a leading solar technology, executives said on a conference call with analysts on Tuesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚杂货商伍尔沃斯第一季度销售额增长约 5
item.description: 澳大利亚伍尔沃斯集团（Woolworths Group）周三公布的第一季度集团销售额增长了 4.5%，原因是食品价格下降有助于提高销售量。【原文：Australia's Woolworths Group reported a 4.5% jump in first-quarter group sales on Wednesday, as lower food prices helped drive more sales volumes.】

item.title: 澳大利亚林纳斯稀土公司第一季度收入下降近 6
item.description: 澳大利亚林纳斯稀土公司（Lynas Rare Earths）周三报告称，由于战略矿物价格下跌和需求低迷，该公司第一季度收入下降了近 6%。【原文：Australia's Lynas Rare Earths reported a nearly 6% decline in first-quarter revenue on Wednesday due to falling prices for strategic minerals and muted demand.】

item.title: Alphabet 和 Snap 的业绩提振了在线广告销售商的股价
item.description: 在亚马逊和 Meta Platforms 发布报告之前，Alphabet、Reddit 和 Snap 的乐观季度业绩提振了投资者的乐观情绪。【原文：Online ad sellers added over $100 billion stock market value late on Tuesday after upbeat quarterly results from Alphabet , Reddit and Snap lifted investor optimism ahead of reports from Amazon and Meta Platforms .】

item.title: L3Harris 生产乌克兰使用的火箭发动机的部门称业务激增
item.description: L3Harris技术公司的子公司Aerojet Rocketdyne公司的一位高管周二表示，该公司已将乌克兰大量使用的GMLRS火箭的发动机月产量增加了一倍，因为全球需求激增，需要向基辅供货，并重建美国不断缩减的库存。【原文：L3Harris Technologies' subsidiary Aerojet Rocketdyne has doubled its monthly production of motors for GMLRS rockets that are heavily used in Ukraine, a company executive said on Tuesday, as global demand surges to supply Kyiv and to rebuild shrinking U.S. stockpiles.】

item.title: 特百惠获得法院批准出售贷款人
item.description: 一名美国破产法官周二批准了特百惠品牌公司（Tupperware Brands）向贷款人出售资产的提议，使该公司得以在大部分业务完好的情况下退出破产程序。【原文：A U.S. bankruptcy judge on Tuesday approved Tupperware Brands' proposal to sell its assets to its lenders, clearing the company to exit bankruptcy with most of its operations intact.】

item.title: 三位州长以供应商受影响为由敦促结束波音罢工
item.description: 犹他州、密苏里州和蒙大拿州的共和党州长周二敦促波音公司和代表 33,000 名罢工机械师的工会结束持续近七周的罢工，理由是罢工会对他们的州和飞机制造商的供应商造成影响。【原文：The Republican governors of Utah, Missouri and Montana on Tuesday urged Boeing and the union representing 33,000 striking machinists to end a nearly seven-week old strike citing the impact to their states and to the planemaker's suppliers.】

item.title: 凯撒娱乐公司季度业绩意外亏损，不及华尔街预期
item.description: 凯撒娱乐公司周二公布的第三季度业绩出人意料地出现亏损，低于市场预期，原因是新的竞争和地区市场与建筑相关的干扰对销售造成了损害，导致其股价在收盘后下跌了 4%。【原文：Caesars Entertainment posted a surprise third-quarter loss on Tuesday, missing market expectations, as sales were hurt by new competition and construction-related disruptions in regional markets, sending its shares down 4% after the bell.】

item.title: 博雅银行考虑就 Zelle 调查起诉美国消费者监督机构
item.description: 美国银行周二表示，正在考虑就美国消费者监督机构对该行通过 Zelle 支付应用程序处理资金的调查起诉该机构。【原文：Bank of America said on Tuesday it was considering suing a U.S. consumer watchdog over the agency's inquiry into the bank's processing of funds through the Zelle payment app.】

item.title: First Solar 下调年度销售预期，第三季度利润增长
item.description: 美国太阳能电池板制造商 First Solar 周二下调了本年度的销售预期，尽管该公司第三季度利润在对外国制造的电池板征收额外关税后价格上涨的帮助下有所增长。【原文：U.S. solar panel maker First Solar lowered its sales forecast for the current year on Tuesday, even after reporting a rise in third-quarter profit helped by higher prices following additional tariffs on foreign-made panels.】

item.title: 文件显示，"咆哮的凯蒂猫 "基思-吉尔解散了 Chewy 公司的全部股份
item.description: 周二提交给美国证券交易委员会的一份文件显示，有 "咆哮的小猫 "之称的股票影响者基思-吉尔（Keith Gill）已经解散了他在宠物产品零售商 Chewy 公司的全部股份。【原文：Keith Gill, the stock influencer known as Roaring Kitty, has dissolved his entire stake in pet products retailer Chewy , a filing with the U.S. SEC showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 受供应链制约，AMD 预计第四季度营收低于预期
item.description: 先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices）周二预计，第四季度营收将略低于预期，原因是供应链限制阻碍了该公司满足人工智能芯片强劲需求的能力，同时个人电脑市场的增长速度比一些投资者预期的要慢。【原文：Advanced Micro Devices on Tuesday forecast fourth-quarter revenue just shy of estimates as supply chain constraints hamper its ability to meet strong demand for AI chips, while the PC market grows more slowly than some investors expected.】

item.title: 墨西哥烤肉店 Chipotle 季度同店销售额不及预期
item.description: 本周二，Chipotle Mexican Grill 第三季度同店销售增长低于市场预期，原因是菜单价格上涨抑制了美国市场对其米饭碗和卷饼的需求。【原文：Chipotle Mexican Grill on Tuesday fell short of market expectations for third-quarter same-store sales growth as higher menu prices deterred demand for its rice bowls and burritos in the United States.】

item.title: Reddit 预计季度收入高于预期，股价大涨 17
item.description: 本周二，Reddit 预计第四季度营收将高于华尔街预期，这主要得益于其人工智能内容授权交易和强劲的数字广告支出。【原文：Reddit forecast fourth-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, helped by its AI content licensing deals and strong digital advertising spend.】

item.title: Snap 营收和用户增长超出预期，宣布 5 亿美元回购
item.description: 本周二，Snap 的季度营收和用户增长均超出华尔街预期，这是因为消息应用 Snapchat 的母公司通过表现更好的广告功能吸引了一些广告商的回归。【原文：Snap beat Wall Street expectations for both quarterly revenue and user growth on Tuesday, as the parent company of messaging app Snapchat has been able to lure back some advertisers with better-performing ad features.】

item.title: 消费者支出回暖，Visa 盈利增加
item.description: 本周二，Visa 公布第四季度利润增长，这主要得益于其银行卡消费的增加。【原文：Visa reported a rise in fourth-quarter profit on Tuesday, thanks to higher spending on its cards.】

item.title: 蒙迪艾尔国际公司因需求稳定而实现季度业绩增长
item.description: Mondelez International 周二公布的第三季度营收和利润超出华尔街预期，原因是吉百利母公司努力提供不同价位的产品，推动了销售量的连续增长。【原文：Mondelez International on Tuesday beat Wall Street expectations for third-quarter revenue and profit, as the Cadbury parent's efforts to provide its products at different price points drove a sequential improvement in sales volumes.】

item.title: 美式足球游戏表现出色，EA 上调年度预订预期
item.description: 电子游戏出版商电子艺界（Electronic Arts）周二上调了对 2025 财年预订额的预期，这得益于其体育游戏在谨慎消费环境下的强劲表现。【原文：Videogame publisher Electronic Arts raised its forecast for fiscal 2025 bookings on Tuesday, helped by strong performance of its sports titles amid a cautious spending environment.】

item.title: 谷歌母公司 Alphabet 季度营收超预期
item.description: 本周二，Alphabet 第三季度营收超出预期，主要得益于其数字广告业务的稳步增长，以及人工智能驱动的云服务需求激增。【原文：Alphabet topped third-quarter revenue expectations on Tuesday, helped by steady growth in its digital advertising business and an AI-driven jump in demand for its cloud services.】

item.title: 英特尔的兴衰
item.description: 英特尔首席执行官帕特-盖尔辛格（Pat Gelsinger）继承了一家陷入困境的公司，这家公司已经失去了制造技术方面的优势，并将利润丰厚的手机和人工智能芯片市场拱手让给了竞争对手。【原文：Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger inherited a troubled company that had lost its edge in manufacturing skills and had ceded to rivals the hugely lucrative markets for chips used in mobile phones and artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 耶伦称调整银行规则有帮助，但严格的资本要求很重要
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周二表示，重要的是要继续根据各机构的活动来调整银行业监管法规的复杂性和严厉程度，以避免过重的合规负担，但她表示自己倾向于制定强有力的资本要求。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Tuesday that it was important to continue tailoring the complexity and severity of banking regulations to the activities of institutions to avoid undue compliance burdens, but said she is predisposed to robust capital requirements.】

item.title: 麦当劳因大肠杆菌爆发被消费者起诉
item.description: 本周二，麦当劳因快餐连锁店 Quarter Pounders 中的洋葱引发大肠杆菌疫情而被消费者集体起诉。【原文：McDonald's was sued on Tuesday by consumers in a proposed class action stemming from the E.coli outbreak linked to onions in the fast-food chain's Quarter Pounders.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：Visa 将裁员约 1400 人和承包商
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二援引知情人士的话报道，信用卡巨头维萨公司计划在今年年底前裁员约 1400 人和承包商。【原文：Card giant Visa is planning to lay off about 1,400 employees and contractors by the end of the year, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Netflix 传播主管和全球公共政策高管离职
item.description: Netflix 周二表示，全球公共政策副总裁迪安-加菲尔德（Dean Garfield）和首席传播官蕾切尔-韦特斯通（Rachel Whetstone）将离开公司。【原文：Netflix said on Tuesday that Vice President of Global Public Policy Dean Garfield, and Chief Communications Officer Rachel Whetstone are leaving the company.】

item.title: 投资者因伪造盖蒂图片公司 40 亿美元收购要约被判入狱
item.description: 本周二，几家上市公司的前首席执行官被判处 10 个月监禁，他承认曾向盖蒂图片控股公司发起价值 40 亿美元的虚假收购要约，以人为抬高这家视觉媒体公司的股价。【原文：A former CEO of several publicly traded companies was sentenced on Tuesday to 10 months in prison after admitting he launched a fake $4 billion takeover bid for Getty Images Holdings to artificially inflate the visual media company's stock price.】

item.title: 特别报道：在英特尔内部，首席执行官帕特-盖尔辛格（Pat Gelsinger）摸索着复兴美国偶像的道路
item.description: 英特尔与台湾台积电达成了一项甜蜜的协议，由台积电生产英特尔设计但无法生产的芯片。消息人士称，台积电为英特尔提供了很高的折扣。【原文：Intel had a sweet deal going with Taiwan’s TSMC, who would make chips that Intel designed but could not produce. And it was offering deep discounts to Intel, sources say.】

item.title: 监督机构指控波音公司向空军多收了近 8000% 的肥皂分配器费用
item.description: 据五角大楼监督机构的一份报告称，波音公司向美国空军多收了 C-17 运输机备件的费用，包括将肥皂分配器的价格抬高了 7943%。【原文：Boeing overcharged the U.S. Air Force for spare parts for C-17 transport planes, including marking up the price on soap dispensers by 7,943%, according to a report by a Pentagon watchdog.】

item.title: 全球需求疲软，Moncler 第三季度销售额下滑 3
item.description: 意大利奢侈服饰制造商 Moncler 第三季度收入按固定汇率计算下降了 3%，略高于分析师的预期，所有主要市场均出现疲软。【原文：Revenues at Italian luxury outwear maker Moncler fell 3% at constant exchange rates in the third quarter, slightly more than analysts had anticipated, with weakness spread across all its main markets.】

item.title: 欧盟对中国电动汽车征收关税，中国政府面临报复风险
item.description: 欧盟决定对中国制造的电动汽车加征高达 45.3% 的关税，这是该调查中最受瞩目的一次。【原文：The European Union has decided to increase tariffs on Chinese-built electric vehicles to as much as 45.3% at the end of its highest profile investigation that has divided Europe and prompted retaliation from Beijing.】
